title: Why is Soraka allowed to exist in her current state
body: I understand the desire for that niche healer class in league, but that type of gameplay is so disheartening to play against its unreal. As a support main I literally just don't even try to trade when I'm against a Soraka because I know any meaningful play will simply be negated by her super spammable heal. Her sole purpose is to negate any bad play by her teammates or, conversely, and good play by her opposition. If you make a good engagement and win a trade botlane, it simply doesn't matter, as she will immediatly heal the ADC to full in seconds. Saying "Focus the Soraka" is unrealistic in laning phase, as she can sit half a lane behind her adc and still be able to do her job. On top of that, and ADC would have to be braindead to not be able to capitalize on the enemy team focusing the support. If you cant burst her immediately you lose, end of story. I would even prefer the old Soraka to the current Soraka, because at least her heal had a meaningful cooldown instead of just being spammable. Now she's just a braindead healbot that only exists to fix her teammates mistakes. Not only is she frustrating to play against, her gameplay is utter garbage. Its an entire game of running around pressing your w while the enemy team tunnelvisions you, because if they dont they simply lose. Not only is this the opposite of fun, its annoying for the team fighting Soraka.  Something needs to be done about her largely negative effect on any game she's in, be it balancing or even another rework.

replies.body: Ugh. Give me a break. If it's really that disheartening for you to wait for a good time to trade, you can always roam mid. What Soraka doesn't have in lane is any kill pressure whatsoever, so your ADC will be fine.
I like the roaming suggestion. See very few people do it.  Is kind of tricky as your marksperson is going to be very sad if they get zoned out of some CS.

Soraka is slow and doesn't really offer much incentive for roaming like bard does.  She also lacks real CC so it's not like she can surprise gank the lane in the same manner someone like leona, annie, or zyra could.  She'd also be much more vulnerable to a jungle gank in mid.

So what conditions are there for her going to mid is a good idea?

The only thing I can think of is your ADC is so terrible and the fact you guys screwed her kit over so badly she can't bully anymore to save the lane that she'd be better off mid and support the carry who has a chance of winning the game for you.

I was approaching this as a playing against tip. Soraka has low kill pressure and is bad at roaming so if you're playing a support opposite of her, you can roam the map more effectively and your marksperson shouldn't have too much threat on them.  

Think we're agreeing, but talking about different sides of the coin.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Sotere,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GqYBv3EE,comment-id=0001000100000000,timestamp=2016-02-29T17:42:54.205+0000)
>
> I was approaching this as a playing against tip. Soraka has low kill pressure and is bad at roaming so if you're playing a support opposite of her, you can roam the map more effectively and your marksperson shouldn't have too much threat on them.  
> 
> Think we're agreeing, but talking about different sides of the coin.

Gotta be pretty confident you'll get something for your roam though cus it still sucks going 1v2 as an adc. Any trades are going to be heavily out of your favor even if they can't kill you

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Sotere,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GqYBv3EE,comment-id=0001000100000000,timestamp=2016-02-29T17:42:54.205+0000)
>
> I was approaching this as a playing against tip. Soraka has low kill pressure and is bad at roaming so if you're playing a support opposite of her, you can roam the map more effectively and your marksperson shouldn't have too much threat on them.  
> 
> Think we're agreeing, but talking about different sides of the coin.

Roaming would add a bunch of kill pressure to the lane simply by the adc being alone, and you need to ensure you gain something from the roam or its a useless tactic. In a structured game this would be easily accomplished, but in the catastrophe that is solo queue roaming to different lanes doesn't always yield results. Furthermore, if you don't make significant plays with your roam, you forfeit your lane and your ADC ends up miles behind the enemy ADC. I feel like any champion who's counterplay is to leave the lane is unhealthy. The ability to inherently win (or at least go even) bot lane is incredibly strong.
I see what you are saying.  Yeah, that makes a lot of sense as she can't roam with you.

> [{quoted}](name=disregardable,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GqYBv3EE,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-02-29T04:15:30.841+0000)
>
> Ugh. Give me a break. If it's really that disheartening for you to wait for a good time to trade, you can always roam mid. What Soraka doesn't have in lane is any kill pressure whatsoever, so your ADC will be fine.

When is a good time to "trade" against a soraka comp in bot lane
Literally any second you are in range of her in a 2v2.

> [{quoted}](name=disregardable,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GqYBv3EE,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2016-02-29T05:03:05.094+0000)
>
> Literally any second you are in range of her in a 2v2.

Which is never because she stays far back so that you can never hit her?
Which is an extreme exaggeration, and even if it wasn't, I already provided a solution (roam mid).

> [{quoted}](name=disregardable,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GqYBv3EE,comment-id=00010000000000000000,timestamp=2016-02-29T05:40:24.602+0000)
>
> Which is an extreme exaggeration, and even if it wasn't, I already provided a solution (roam mid).

Your solution is to leave the lane, which is my point entirely. You don't win trades unless you can 100-0 the Soraka immediately. And with the falling off of ap supports that is harder than it sounds unless the enemy bot lane makes huge mistakes. And roaming isn't the godly solution you make it out to be. Unless you make a significant play with your roam (which isn't guaranteed in solo queue) you're setting yourself up for failure. Leaving an ADC alone bot lane is forfeiting your lane and adding inherent kill pressure simply by them being 2v1. This can be further punished by a dive, which is incredibly easy with Sorakas spammable heal. At that point you will have lost your lane, which is the point I was trying to make. Soraka lacks meaningful and direct counterplay and forces the bot lane in an unhealthy direction balance wise.

> [{quoted}](name=disregardable,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GqYBv3EE,comment-id=00010000000000000000,timestamp=2016-02-29T05:40:24.602+0000)
>
> Which is an extreme exaggeration, and even if it wasn't, I already provided a solution (roam mid).

It's not an exaggeration at all, why on earth would a soraka go anywhere near the other places. She's generally several units behind her ADC so that she can heal him, and not take any damage. That's her playstyle.

I don't see how roaming mid is a solution either. So you have a gold/xp starved ADC and an underleveled mid laner just to trade mid turret for bot turret?

> [{quoted}](name=Mayor Stubbs,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GqYBv3EE,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2016-02-29T05:36:42.605+0000)
>
> Which is never because she stays far back so that you can never hit her?

If she's that far back she can't harass meaning it's basically a 2v1 against her adc. Soraka's healing alone isn't enough to cause one adc to outrace an adc and a support.

Her heals are also pretty costly. Healing away your poke still costs her health and mana, and she will need to 'b' at some point unless you are standing in starfalls (meaning you're failing at counterplay while Soraka is getting in range for you to attack her directly)

> [{quoted}](name=Quepha,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GqYBv3EE,comment-id=00010000000000000001,timestamp=2016-02-29T07:32:33.547+0000)
>
> If she's that far back she can't harass meaning it's basically a 2v1 against her adc. Soraka's healing alone isn't enough to cause one adc to outrace an adc and a support.
> 
> Her heals are also pretty costly. Healing away your poke still costs her health and mana, and she will need to 'b' at some point unless you are standing in starfalls (meaning you're failing at counterplay while Soraka is getting in range for you to attack her directly)

Soraka doesn't have harass even if she plays up close, which is why she stays back so far anyway. Any damage done to sorakas ADC will be healed up, it's not smart or efficient to bother trading against a Soraka comp. It literally turns into a farm lane (Unless you are able to go for an all in with someone like a leona ignite, but you pretty much have to all in the Soraka, not the adc). 

Sorakas heals are _not_ costly at all. The mana cost is negligible, and the health cost is only 10% of her max health. She has her natural health regen, plus she always starts coin so she gains health for every minion that dies near her, and she is able to start 3 health pots. I play soraka sup anytime I play sup and shes not banned and NEVER have to back even against a bot lane that tries to harass heavily. (Plus her starcall heals her a LOT also, but this does require her to be in range to use it - which is almost never necesary)

TL;DR: The only option against Soraka is to have a pretty boring farm lane. A second option would be an all in comp, but it's risky because if you fail and don't get a kill you will likely have to back and they won't.

Raka is getting nerfed next patch.

Raka has counters.  Annie is her biggest one.

Burst > Sustain > Poke > Burst

Thats how the triangle goes.  Raka is Sustain, so she gets beat by Burst, so Annie.

> [{quoted}](name=Fanny Forecast,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GqYBv3EE,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2016-02-29T07:13:59.405+0000)

> 
> Raka has counters.  Annie is her biggest one.
> 


Nope, any Raka player will know to build her tank and tanks counter Annie hard. An annie would rather not waste the stun/tibbers combo on a tank she knows isin't going to die from the burst.

Raka early game is squish.  The minute annie hits 6, she drops tibbers on raka, free kill.  Then the ADCs can duke it out with Annie autoing and throwing a Q when its off cd.

Late game, if the raka goes tank, the ADC will have a last whisper item.  Someone in top or jungle will likely have cleaver, too.  Your mid laner will get void staff. All of those counter tank stacking.

Build properly, pick against her, easy game, easy life.

> [{quoted}](name=Fanny Forecast,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GqYBv3EE,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2016-02-29T07:13:59.405+0000)
>
> Raka is getting nerfed next patch.
> 
> Raka has counters.  Annie is her biggest one.
> 
> Burst > Sustain > Poke > Burst
> 
> Thats how the triangle goes.  Raka is Sustain, so she gets beat by Burst, so Annie.

Annie isn't as prevalent in bot lane anymore, but I see where you're trying to go, as burst does counter her healing. But unless the burst is enough to kill her outright, the adc will always have an advantage from you using your damage on the support or the Soraka getting summoner healed + her ult and continuing to heal her adc. Since the grevious wounds nerf and the nerf of ap supports, soraka has been lacking counterplay.

As a Soraka main, Honestly, the thing is, SHE'S BEEN LIKE THIS FOR AGES. The only thing holding her back was Grievous wounds negating half of her healing. Honestly, out of all the pre-season changes, the Grievous Wounds changes were what sent Soraka overboard. She's always been balanced around them negating her healing, so now that they dont, Soraka has just gone insane.

What Riot NEEDS to do is add in  unique debuff available as an upgrade to Executioner's or Morellonomicon that is the old Grievous wounds that stops all healing, not just self-healing. you do that and BOOM, Soraka drops in popularity as the source of counterplay to her non-stop healing is returned.

As long as the Grievous wounds changes stay as they are, Soraka being a godly healer will always be opporessive/frustrating.

> [{quoted}](name=CrazedPorcupine,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GqYBv3EE,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2016-02-29T05:44:38.511+0000)
>
> As a Soraka main, Honestly, the thing is, SHE'S BEEN LIKE THIS FOR AGES. The only thing holding her back was Grievous wounds negating half of her healing. Honestly, out of all the pre-season changes, the Grievous Wounds changes were what sent Soraka overboard. She's always been balanced around them negating her healing, so now that they dont, Soraka has just gone insane.
> 
> What Riot NEEDS to do is add in  unique debuff available as an upgrade to Executioner's or Morellonomicon that is the old Grievous wounds that stops all healing, not just self-healing. you do that and BOOM, Soraka drops in popularity as the source of counterplay to her non-stop healing is returned.
> 
> As long as the Grievous wounds changes stay as they are, Soraka being a godly healer will always be opporessive/frustrating.

How can you say shes been like this for ages? Her heal used to have a 16 second CD and now it has a 2 second CD. This is the massive difference that makes her so frustrating to play against.

Except, when it has a 16 sec cooldown, it had a base power of nearly 300, and granted massive amounts of armor.

To be Precise, before her REwork, it was a 240 power heal that granted 105 Armor. I'm sorry but how is that less frustrating to play against?

Before the Armor buff was added to it, it healed for 350 health at rank 5. When the Armor was first added, the heal was reduced to 270 but granted 125 Armor as well.

I'm sorry, but Soraka has always been frustrating as hell. OH and let's not forget that riot made her MR shred scale with AP, and gave her an instant cast 3 second silence. She became the most OP solo laner for several patches.

> [{quoted}](name=CrazedPorcupine,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GqYBv3EE,comment-id=000500010000,timestamp=2016-02-29T22:56:18.521+0000)
>
> Except, when it has a 16 sec cooldown, it had a base power of nearly 300, and granted massive amounts of armor.
> 
> To be Precise, before her REwork, it was a 240 power heal that granted 105 Armor. I'm sorry but how is that less frustrating to play against?
> 
> Before the Armor buff was added to it, it healed for 350 health at rank 5. When the Armor was first added, the heal was reduced to 270 but granted 125 Armor as well.
> 
> I'm sorry, but Soraka has always been frustrating as hell. OH and let's not forget that riot made her MR shred scale with AP, and gave her an instant cast 3 second silence. She became the most OP solo laner for several patches.

Well let me tell you how it became more frustrating to play against. 

Prerework Soraka's base healing over 16 seconds: 350 health

Current Soraka's healing over 16 seconds: 1920 health

She was pretty much not even viable before the rework, so I'm glad they changed her. But she heals ridiculous amounts more, for less and it can't be affected by grievous wounds. This is why shes more frustrating to play against now.

Current Soraka's HP after non-stop healing without landing a Q, <20%.

NOT EVEN VIABLE? I've been a soraka main since Season 2. Let's not forget a few things about soraka's Kit pre-rework.

Landing Q reduced W cooldown by 10% of its BASE.
Soraka could heal herself with her W.
Soraka had a 2.5 second point and click silence NUKE.
Soraka could grant a Thornmail's worth of armor to anyone for 2 seconds. (That's a value of over 2500 gold)

Soraka's build during that time was still a 40% CDR build (Like all supports). Soraka's healing over "16 seconds" if she landed several Qs, could be easily 1400 HP that also included 2 seconds of an EH of nearly 2k just from the armor she granted.

I'm sorry but pre-rework Soraka was MORE than Viable. She was stupidly strong. Hell I'd troll people and go Heal/CV Soraka with Elesia's Miracle Rush and then build a Mikael's Crucible. I'd have 4 heals, and the ability to heal myself 4 times over.

TELL ME MORE ABOUT HOW SORAKA WASN'T A BROKEN HEALING WHORE BEFORE HER REWORK.

> [{quoted}](name=CrazedPorcupine,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GqYBv3EE,comment-id=00050001000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-01T04:41:42.038+0000)
>
> Current Soraka's HP after non-stop healing without landing a Q, <20%.
> 
> NOT EVEN VIABLE? I've been a soraka main since Season 2. Let's not forget a few things about soraka's Kit pre-rework.
> 
> Landing Q reduced W cooldown by 10% of its BASE.
> Soraka could heal herself with her W.
> Soraka had a 2.5 second point and click silence NUKE.
> Soraka could grant a Thornmail's worth of armor to anyone for 2 seconds. (That's a value of over 2500 gold)
> 
> Soraka's build during that time was still a 40% CDR build (Like all supports). Soraka's healing over "16 seconds" if she landed several Qs, could be easily 1400 HP that also included 2 seconds of an EH of nearly 2k just from the armor she granted.
> 
> I'm sorry but pre-rework Soraka was MORE than Viable. She was stupidly strong. Hell I'd troll people and go Heal/CV Soraka with Elesia's Miracle Rush and then build a Mikael's Crucible. I'd have 4 heals, and the ability to heal myself 4 times over.
> 
> TELL ME MORE ABOUT HOW SORAKA WASN'T A BROKEN HEALING WHORE BEFORE HER REWORK.

Maybe I was going a bit far saying she was unviable, but I really do think she was a bottom tier support. As compared to now, where she's considered pretty good - but also extremely frustrating to play against.

> [{quoted}](name=Mayor Stubbs,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GqYBv3EE,comment-id=000500010000000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-01T05:34:19.265+0000)
>
> Maybe I was going a bit far saying she was unviable, but I really do think she was a bottom tier support. As compared to now, where she's considered pretty good - but also extremely frustrating to play against.

Oh, she was simply way more niche than she is now. The point and click silence screwed over champs like Riven, Zed, LB and such who relied on combos.

> [{quoted}](name=CrazedPorcupine,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GqYBv3EE,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2016-02-29T05:44:38.511+0000)
>
> As a Soraka main, Honestly, the thing is, SHE'S BEEN LIKE THIS FOR AGES. The only thing holding her back was Grievous wounds negating half of her healing. Honestly, out of all the pre-season changes, the Grievous Wounds changes were what sent Soraka overboard. She's always been balanced around them negating her healing, so now that they dont, Soraka has just gone insane.
> 
> What Riot NEEDS to do is add in  unique debuff available as an upgrade to Executioner's or Morellonomicon that is the old Grievous wounds that stops all healing, not just self-healing. you do that and BOOM, Soraka drops in popularity as the source of counterplay to her non-stop healing is returned.
> 
> As long as the Grievous wounds changes stay as they are, Soraka being a godly healer will always be opporessive/frustrating.

Really kinda think people were complaining a ton about her even before preseason, for almost as long as I've been playing
She is getting nerfed to ground in PBE i believe.{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
I will gladly take a dedicated healer over a permazoner who is a dangerous threat at level 1 to being a permazoner who is a dangerous threat at level 18 by by virtue of not using their skills

I always thought Sona was an excellent choice against Soraka. She has healz and an insane poke(burst) for a support. Also the W power cord has damage reduction if the adc can't do as much damage even with a Soraka they lose trades. I know people always prefer counterplay to counterpicks but it's an idea.

There's major changes on the PBE right now... they keep delaying the changes, but if we're lucky, it'll actually come out next patch.

I think there's somewhat of a problem where dedicated healer champs can only really ever be necessary or, if they aren't necessary, obnoxious.

Soraka has to come forward to land her Q otherwise she can't keep healing. They recently nerfed the range on her Q so she has to be pretty darn close to try and land it.

If she is somehow magically staying super far back all the time, take Blitz and pull her ADC out of her range to do anything.

She also can't handle burst. Especially vs AA champs since her only CC is a silence. Nothing is more frustrating as a Soraka than a mid-late game Vayne/Yi. Like there is absolutely nothing she can do vs. them.

Honestly i don't really ever have an issue with soraka anymore, i'm not sure if that's because i'm in silver right now or what. Every time I see soraka picked I go naut and alternate harass on soraka/adc and when she is around 60-70% health just wait for a catch and gg she dies. Shes extremely squishy and if you focus her she doesn't have much that she can do to stop you. As long as you don't get hit by starcalls you are making her more susceptible to being all in-ed.
Seriously I hate this champ right now. Honestly, if they just gave her a small cooldown on her heal (example: 4 seconds after CDR) she would be fine.
